revision.comment: Tagging for Historic houses task force per [[WP:BOTREQ]] using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (10302)
revision.text:
{{Talk header}} {{GA|00:44, 18 February 2014 (UTC)|topic=War|page=1|oldid=595958264}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST |class=GA |Fortifications=yes |Technology=yes |British=yes |Medieval= yes |Early-Modern= yes }} {{WikiProject Architecture|class=GA}} {{WikiProject UK geography|class=GA|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject England|class=GA|importance=mid}} }}
==Lead Picture==
I hope nobody objects if I upload a sunnier picture of the castle as the lead picture [[User:Mjobling|Mjobling]] 19:16, 3 August 2006 (UTC)
: No, that looks much better. [[User:Barney Jenkins|Barney Jenkins]] 19:39, 3 August 2006 (UTC)
*It's a fortified manor, distinctly not a castle. I haven't deleted it from the castles categories however. --[[User:Wetman|Wetman]] 14:47, 27 March 2007 (UTC)
*I agree with you, but why do they call it 'stokesay castle' then?? --[[User:Matthewcl375|Matthewcl375]] 20:27, 14 April 2007 (UTC)
: The fortified manor house was however a direct development of the castle; it was the next evolutionary stage in building design, as defence became less important and luxury and comfort became more important. Most castle history books also include fortified manor houses and, ironically the castle which is most people's image of the typical castle, [[Bodiam Castle]] is actually a fortified manor house as well --[[User:Mjobling|Mjobling]] 15:48, 23 April 2007 (UTC)
== Stokesay castle ==
I've never been there but i here it's very pretty and it's one of my favourite british castles. Does anyone know if there are any regurlar guided tours around the site? Also, roughly how long does it take to look around it? --[[User:Matthewcl375|Matthewcl375]] 20:26, 14 April 2007 (UTC) : It is a lovely place. As with most English Heritage sites, the tour is self-guided. You get a computerised handset and enter the numbers as you explore the buildings and grounds. --[[User:Mjobling|Mjobling]] 15:53, 23 April 2007 (UTC)
== "dating to the 12th century"? ==
Isn't that somewhat misleading? Yes, the farm was around by then, but the building as we look at it today is 13th century. [[Special:Contributions/86.132.142.207|86.132.142.207]] ([[User talk:86.132.142.207|talk]]) 20:12, 29 July 2008 (UTC)
:According to the Images of England [http://www.imagesofengland.org.uk/details/default.aspx?pid=1&id=460272 website], the manor house is late 14th century. There is no other source in the article to verify the date, but the article probably needs a rewrite. [[User:Nev1|Nev1]] ([[User talk:Nev1|talk]]) 20:18, 29 July 2008 (UTC)
==Copyright problem== I just [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stokesay_Castle&diff=next&oldid=405377129 removed] some text that is more or less copied from [http://www.aiaeasternpa.org/ColorBook_files/StokesayCastle_B.pdf this source]. The copyright violation was in the article for [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Stokesay_Castle&action=historysubmit&diff=334213987&oldid=333669650 over a year]. [[User:Nev1|Nev1]] ([[User talk:Nev1|talk]]) 21:24, 1 January 2011 (UTC)
== Expansion... ==
I've given the article a thorough review - everything should be up to date now. I've two specialist sources left to check over, which I should get hold of the coming 3-4 weeks, and I'll see if they add anything more. [[User:Hchc2009|Hchc2009]] ([[User talk:Hchc2009|talk]]) 09:14, 2 January 2014 (UTC)
